page.title: 03Local History
page.content: The{flood}started in{1852}when the Bilberry Reservoir burst and washed away Digley Mill. The big chimney was left but later it was knocked down because it was dangerous. It flooded right down to Holmfirth. It washed down to Holmbridge church and the bodies floated down the valley. An old lady knew the flood was coming, she put her wire rimmed glasses in her bible. The bible is in the Holmbridge Parish Church and the mark of the glasses can be seen. The flood caused a lot of people to loose their lives, also a lot of farm land was destroyed. 81 people died in the disaster flood and 7,000 people were out of a job. On Waterside Lane 20 people died .
